intro: Clinopodium multicaule var. minimum, commonly known as dwarf creeping thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe. It features small, aromatic leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in length, giving it a dense, mat-like appearance. The plant produces tiny white or pale purple flowers in early summer, which are clustered in whorls along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its compact size and fragrant foliage make it a popular choice for ornamental and medicinal purposes.
